oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate Monument at Murfreesboro

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Sculpture; Courthouses; Automobiles
Monuments; Soldiers; Murfreesboro (Tenn.); United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate soldier with poised rifle is positioned atop the Confederate Monument at Murfreesboro. The background of the image is occupied by the Rutherford County Courthouse, fronted by 1950s-1960s era automobiles and parking meters.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Civil War Centennial Commission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A crowd of 3,000 people witnessed the unveiling and dedication of Murfreesboro's Confederate Monument on the Court Square. Senator William B. Bate and Governor Benton McMillin attended the ceremony. The monument honors the valor of those Confederates who died at the Battle of Murfreesboro and other engagements in the vicinity. It was funded by the early efforts of the Monument Association and furthered by the work of the Daughters of the Confederacy and the Palmer Bivouac.
